remarks: The limit of a continuous function, theorem form.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2014.)
statement:
climcn1lem.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
climcn1lem.2 $e |- ( ph -> F ~~> A ) $.
climcn1lem.4 $e |- ( ph -> G e. W ) $.
climcn1lem.5 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
climcn1lem.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
climcn1lem.7 $e |- H : CC --> CC $.
climcn1lem.8 $e |- ( ( A e. CC /\ x e. RR+ ) -> E. y e. RR+ A. z e. CC ( ( abs ` ( z - A ) ) < y -> ( abs ` ( ( H ` z ) - ( H ` A ) ) ) < x ) ) $.
climcn1lem.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) = ( H ` ( F ` k ) ) ) $.
climcn1lem $p |- ( ph -> G ~~> ( H ` A ) ) $.
$d A k x y z $.
$d F k y z $.
$d G k x $.
$d H k x y z $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k y $.
$d k ph x y z $.
